conclusion: Objects A and B are lowered due to gravity and come into contact with objects C, D, E, and F.
Gravity will pull objects A and B straight down until something stops them.
Object A is positioned above two blue blocks labeled C and D on the left side.
Object A will reach the two blue blocks (C and D) first and will either sit on their upper faces or nudge them slightly until all three pieces find a stable, level contact.
Object B is positioned above a green-and-yellow block stack labeled E and F on the right side.
Object B will meet the green-and-yellow block stack (E and F) and will end up resting on the highest part of that stack or push the stack just enough to let everything settle.
Once the brief readjustment ends, object A will be supported by C and D, and object B will be supported by E and F.
All six blocks will be at rest and held together by static friction.
No further motion occurs unless an outside force is applied.
